summary: hello! can i get a matchup please? im a 5'6 female with dark brown hair. i just dyed a strip of it blonde! My eyes are a...
question: hello! can i get a matchup please? im a 5'6 female with dark brown hair. i just dyed a strip of it blonde! My eyes are a brown/hazel and i have pale skin with freckles. Ive got a pear shaped body aswell. I like to joke around alot, but sometimes im mean without realizing. Im also filled with anxiety. Im pretty sleepy a lot lol. I enjoy reading! I own 4 cats. Im not too great at showing affection, but im full of love! i like to play video games and chill about. I hope this is enough, thank you!!!
answer:
I would pair you up with Mirio! He can always enjoy a humorous person that can make him laugh, he especially loves it if he can make the jokeful person (you) laugh! Mirio knows you never mean to sound rude, he knows that you are a sweet and lovable person! Mirio knows how to handle anxiety, being a hero you have to learn how to help others remain calm. He has a handful of techniques to help anxiety and he is always there to listen if you need him too. Though Mirio tends to be more of an energetic person, he can totally get behind just sleeping next to each other after a long day! He can also enjoy occasional competitive video game session! He also adores your cats and is practically always covered in cat hair now. Though you may have a hard time showing affection, it’s fine! Mirio easily understands how much you care about him and you’ll be able to understand how much you matter to him!


I hope you enjoyed and have a great day!

Ophelia

summary: Heey is it okay if you match me up with someone? Im black haired ( shoulder length) and I'm pretty round too. Im an introvert...
question: Heey is it okay if you match me up with someone? Im black haired ( shoulder length) and I'm pretty round too. Im an introvert but I'll always encourage a conversation with anyone that tries to talk to me, I love books and would love to be a writer someday. I'd rather listen to people's complaints than share my own insecirities. Yes I suck at opening up. The people around me think that I'm this carefree jokester but I'm just really, really lonely.
answer:
I would match you up with Midoriya! He a soft and gentle personality, one that is easy to talk to and he would most certainly love entertaining a conversation with you! Midoriya is a huge bookworm so you have to let him read your writings one day, and he’ll most certainly encourage you to become a writer. He’ll be your personal cheerleader the whole way! Midoriya can definitely appreciate that you can be the type of person that lets him have a shoulder to cry on, though one day he would like to do the same for you! Midoriya knows the feeling of being alone, he will offer you as much love, affection and friendship you need. He’ll always be reassuring you, that he cares a whole ton about you as well!


I hope you enjoyed and have a great day! Also hun, if you are ever feeling lonely you can always send me a message either if you want to talk or a shoulder to cry on!

Ophelia

blog.description: Hello, Guys, Gals, and Non-binary pals! Welcome to my humble Bnha Headcanons and Match-ups! REQUESTS ARE CURRENTLY OPEN BUT, I'M ONLY TAKING HEADCANONS RIGHT NOW!!! Thank you!

summary: Fluffy headcannons for Mirio, All Might, and (another tall dude, you can choose) with their really short (like 5 feet idk) s/o...
question: Fluffy headcannons for Mirio, All Might, and (another tall dude, you can choose) with their really short (like 5 feet idk) s/o please
answer:
I decided to choose Aizawa because I’m always drowning myself in coffee and I love Aizawa since he basically does the same. Aizawa is also cute Hope this is fluffy enough! Congrats for being my 100th post as well!


Mirio:

-Mirio isn’t the type of person who teases their lover for their height but, he most definitely secretly loves being much taller than his S/O.

- He likes watching their cute expression when the stand on their tiptoes to kiss him.

-Mirio is the type of boyfriend that lets your sit on his shoulders so you can see up higher. Makes concerts or public events much easier since you two can now see with much ease. You most certainly kiss him when you sit upon his shoulders!

-When you two end up walking for a long time, Mirio will eventually end up giving you a piggyback ride. Doesn’t matter where you two are, you are getting an impromptu piggyback ride.

-One time you two played hide and seek. Yeah Mirio still never knows where you went to hide that eventful day! You’re also the pro at hide and seek since you can easily spot and tall people (aka Mirio) attempting to hide!



All Might:

-All Might always found it slightly funny to compare him and his lover’s heights. He’s always found their short stature to be cute (yes, he found it so cute he has coughed out blood a few times.)

-All Might most certainly loves to pick them up bridal style and pepper their face in kisses.

-Whenever his S/O wears one of his shirts, he has to be rushed to Recovery Girl because they look so cute since his shirt is practically a dress on them.

-S/O permanently has to carry around a mini first aid kit with them, since poor Toshinori ends up bonking his head on so many door frames. Though luckily a few kisses can help ease Toshinori’s pain.

-If it’s ever sunny, just hide behind your tall boyfriend and perfect shade! Toshinori does find that action quite adorable, especially if you end up hugging him from behind as well as avoiding the sunlight.



Aizawa:

-Aizawa most certainly teases his S/O for their height. He snickers when they can’t reach the food in a cabinet or that one time they weren’t allowed on a ride. Though he most certainly chuckles when they can’t reach his lips to kiss him.

-Probably has asked ‘how the weather is down there’ at least once before their S/O groaned and Aizawa then proceeded to kiss them on top of their head.

-On the plus side, you two can share a sleeping bag, which makes for perfect cuddles!

-If it’s raining, Aizawa is the one holding the umbrella and probably discreetly wraps his arm around your shoulder.

-Even though you may be short, you are most certainly the big spoon. Aizawa hates to admit it but, he enjoys being surrounded by your affection and love!



I hope you enjoyed and have a great day!

Ophelia

title: bnha headcanons
body:
• uraraka loves pink (she loves some girly things)
  • tsuyu doesn’t like leather texture, says it reminds her of kiri’s hard skin
  • bakugou likes Taylor swift and kiri one time caught him singing love story in the shower. bakugou made him swear to never say anything about it (kiri thinks he sings reeeeeeally good and tbh he does)
  • kaminari is scared of the dark
  • sero like to do a marathon of joke asmr with the squad except bakugou , he doesnt get the tingles 
  • mina writes texts with a lot of emojis (some ironically, some not)
  • everyone on the bakusquad has tiktok, kiri does one once in a while (mainly for memes) kaminari, sero and mina use it JUST for shitposting and bakugo to rant and for pranks
  • sero and mina are subbed to pews
  • all girls in class 1-a are gay
  • so are the boys
  • and teachers
  • everyone except grape boi is gay
  • mineta has the biggest trash bag bc of hentai and tissues full of cum
  • momo & todoroki know how to play the piano and the do duets 
  • momo has wavy-curly hair but she gets it straight ( not like her lmao)
  • tsuyus bedroom is similar to ojiro’s but with plushes and plants
  • bakugou , tokoyami, jirou and shinso are the chaotic goths
  • when kiri wakes up from a nightmare he goes to bakugou’s room and stays until he’s ready to return to bed
  • mina favorite’s color is yellow
  • mina has a dirty pleasure for chicken nuggets
  • bakugou takes a lot of care of his hair and its spiky but soft and fluffy (in its own way)
  • the girls, deku, bakugou, denki, sato like & play the sims
  • todoroki is good at chess (when he was six his bro taught him and  he won)
  • jirou knows sing language cuz she tinks its cool
  • tenya is the only one single in the dekusquad
  • momo & jirou are romantics and love having dates
  • uraraka’s & tsuyu’s favorite flower is the daisy
  • momo’s is the cherry blossom
  • & jirou’s are white roses
  • koda is the exorcist of bugs that get in people’s rooms
  • momo likes cats AND dogs
  • mina has The Lesbian Vibe™
  • hagakure loves pastel things and the pastel princess style 
  • mitsuki yelled at bakugo if he sleeped late and it became a habit to sleep early 
  • some of urarakas clothes are her mother’s old outfits
  • momo has a kinda vintage-classy dressing style
  • sero listens to ~lofi chill / jazz music 24/7~ while he studies or does homework
  • one of momo’s favorite things to make is stuffed animals ans¡d she gives them to tsuyu and hagakure
  • imagine the whole class going to a pride festival
  • jirou and kaminari are bffs 
  • but his top bff are kiri and ser
  • sometimes sero yells “HIT OR MISS” and tmina and denki respond with “ I GUESS THEY NEVER MISS HUH” in the common room and bakugo is sick of it
  • katsuki secretly loves cuddles and it’s normal to him to cuddle with kiri in their room (its a secret tho)

and i have alot more but hufibhoefs i don‘t wanna bore anyone whos reading (my mom in several accounts lmaooo)

but if you want more,,, you can,,, tell me

k bye bbs

title: Snowflakes [1/???]
body:
Kaminari x Reader x Shinsou

Summary: You just couldn’t help yourself.

Read On AO3

Subscribe to me on AO3! | Tip Me? | Patreon

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

You dodged them for as long as you could.

Ducking behind an empathetic Jirou and hiding behind Bakugou and Iida like a coward. Too nervous and weak to look at either man, especially now that Kaminari had been turned. The pair of you had probably been tempting fate with your playful, borderline friendly banter with the violet-eyed vampire, but you’d never imagined you’d actually be in a position where your boyfriend had been turned and you were left the minority of the weird relationship.

“Y/N!” His cheerful call made you flinch from your position on the couch. He couldn’t get in — neither of them could — but that didn’t mean they weren’t relentless with their tormenting.

“Fuck off, Denki!” You shouted, returning to your phone game with a heavy heart. Anything to make the hairs on the back of your neck lie down. The feeling of being watched was putting a serious strain on your nerves; you weren’t sure how much more of their attention you could take.

“Baby, don’t be like that!” He laughed, knocking on your front door.

The other hunters had all but abandoned you when it became clear you were essentially a homing beacon to the pair. It was a sore subject, but there was nothing that could be done. You weren’t willing to hunt them down — Jirou more than anyone understood that — and so you had resigned yourself to being an evening shut-in. As long as you were in your own home, they couldn’t get to you at night; during the day, you just had to be sure to be armed and stay close to your dwindling group of friends.

“Y/N,” Shinsou called, and you could practically feel his smirk when your heart stuttered uncomfortably. If it was just Kaminari, you wouldn’t have been nearly as nervous. He was a young vampire, more interested in teasing you than feeding off you — at least, you hoped so, since he apparently had very violent feeding habits — but Shinsou? Shinsou would love nothing more than to feed from you, and you couldn’t risk being compelled.

“You could at least come to the door and talk to us.” You scoffed, making yourself more comfortable on the couch. There was no earthly way you would be able to look at them and hold a conversation. Even thinking about Kaminaris fate made you nauseous, but your strange attraction to Shinsou? Not something you ever wanted to deal with. It had been wrong when you’d been with Kaminari, and it was just as wrong now that you weren’t. The flirting never seemed to bother your boyfriend, but the guilt always ate at you later. It was always harmless, because you would never have hooked up with him or anything, but it was haunting you even a month later.

“I don’t want to talk to either of you.” It was stupid to even humor the conversation. All it did was make you ache for a simpler time, before all the bloodshed and drama. When it was just you and Kaminari and your weird friendliness with Shinsou wasn’t anything more than a bit of an adrenaline rush.

“Liar.” Kaminari purred, and you almost choked, feeling blood rush to your face. It wasn’t often that he called you out like that; the embarrassment at having been caught in your silent pining sent a shiver down your spine.

“You guys need to leave me alone.” You whispered, knowing they could still hear you even through the wall.

“You could always make us.” Shinsou offered, mockingly. “That’s what you do, right? Or are you still too scared to face us?” Anger ignited in you at that, and before you’d thought your plan all the way through you’d stormed to your door and nearly ripped it off its hinges in your hurry to open it. You regretted that decision instantly when two matching, predatory grins were suddenly directed at you. Just as quickly as your anger had ignited, it was gone, and you were standing awkwardly on the safe side of the threshold feeling your heartbeat hammering away at your rib cage. Blood rushed to your face, embarrassment and shame prickling against your skin as you attempted to come up with something threatening to say.

“Leave.” You hated that it came out a somewhat choked warble, even as you moved to slam the door in their smug faces.

Ever the smart one, Shinsou blocked it from closing with his coat; Kaminari caught on quickly enough to go fetch a stick from nearby and replace the offending garment with it. Even though they couldn’t cross the threshold, apparently they were smart enough to keep the door open. You attempted several more times — only to be stopped by a fucking stick — to slam it before surrendering and stumbling back. The door creaked open slowly and you made sure to glare at the men on the other side.

“Are you kidding me?” A ringing in your ears suddenly chilled you to your core, and your previous irritation gave way to legitimate fear as Shinsou leaned forward, leveling his face with yours.

“Aren’t you going to invite us in?” Panic settled over you. Panic. Scream. Run. Your body didn’t move. Compulsion was a tricky thing, though; Shinsou didn’t really even need to use it, considering his own special ability. You stayed silent, staring at him with a scowl despite the low thrum in your mind. They couldn’t make you invite them in. You didn’t have even the slightest inclination to let them into your safe space. Nobody even had a key to your little house, thanks to your paranoia.

“C’mon, Y/N, don’t be like that!” Kaminari whined, still grinning over Shinsous shoulder and you grit your teeth. Shinsou stared into your eyes thoughtfully, obviously weighing his options.

“Haven’t you missed us?” A pang in your chest. You had missed Kaminari. Even Shinsou, in a weird sort of way. You’d come into the fold after Shinsou had been turned — essentially his replacement — but you and Kaminari had hit it off and despite everything, their lingering friendship had remained and ruined everything for you. Jirou had told you, offhandedly, about how close they were; you could see now it had been a warning.

“Then come here.” Their grins grew when you inched over the threshold at the soft command, only amplified by the teasing beckoning motion Kaminari used. Before your sudden change in situation even full processed, you were sandwiched between the vampires; caged between them by two sets of arms coiled around you. You could feel your heart in your throat, beating wildly as you trashed and squirmed about, letting out a soft curse for having been so stupid.

And then Kaminari was kissing you.

It was hard and fast and needy, and you could taste the want on his tongue. You hadn’t even noticed you’d went limp in Shinsous grip until he chuckled and nuzzled at your neck. Your fingers dug into the front of Kaminari’s shirt, torn between pulling him closer and pushing him away. Luckily, the blond made the decision for you and pulled back, licking his lips and pressing his forehead to yours. He didn’t even spare a glance at Shinsou, who’d taken to peppering feather light kisses at your pulse; you were admittedly dazed but thoroughly enjoying the sensation.

“See? Not that bad, is it?” Kaminari purred. Shinsou scoffed out a laugh against your skin and you flinched when something sharp — presumably his fangs — dragged along your neck.

“Y/N?!” Jirous voice garnered your attention, and everybody seemed to freeze at the interruption. How the pair of vampires had missed the arrival of your hunter friends was beyond you, but after Shinsou released you with a sigh and stepped off the porch, Kaminari pressed another kiss to your cheek before following. You were a flustered, blushing mess on your front porch as they shouldered by the hunters and headed on their merry way.

“Uh—” You couldn’t look at any of your friends as they hurried to fuss over you, looking for any signs of being bitten.

It took several seconds of their pestering before you worked up the nerve to tell them that they hadn’t bitten you, much less tried anything else even remotely sinister. They’d just been toying with you, like you and Kaminari had toyed with Shinsou. Jirou had looked at you with something akin to understanding; you realized that the two of you had a very heavy cross to bare. You knew your affection for your vampiric lovers would bring nothing but trouble, and wondered what exactly it would mean for you in the future.

Kaminari x Reader x Shinsou

Summary: You just couldn’t help yourself.

“You could at least come to the door and talk to us.” You scoffed, making yourself more comfortable on the couch. There was no earthly way you would be able to look at them and hold a conversation. Even thinking about Kaminaris fate made you nauseous, but your strange attraction to Shinsou? Not something you ever wanted to deal with. It had been wrong when you’d been with Kaminari, and it was just as wrong now that you weren’t. The flirting never seemed to bother your boyfriend, but the guilt always ate at you later. It was always harmless, because you would never have hooked up with him or anything, but it was haunting you even a month later.

“I don’t want to talk to either of you.” It was stupid to even humor the conversation. All it did was make you ache for a simpler time, before all the bloodshed and drama. When it was just you and Kaminari and your weird friendliness with Shinsou wasn’t anything more than a bit of an adrenaline rush.

“Liar.” Kaminari purred, and you almost choked, feeling blood rush to your face. It wasn’t often that he called you out like that; the embarrassment at having been caught in your silent pining sent a shiver down your spine.

“You guys need to leave me alone.” You whispered, knowing they could still hear you even through the wall.

“You could always make us.” Shinsou offered, mockingly. “That’s what you do, right? Or are you still too scared to face us?” Anger ignited in you at that, and before you’d thought your plan all the way through you’d stormed to your door and nearly ripped it off its hinges in your hurry to open it. You regretted that decision instantly when two matching, predatory grins were suddenly directed at you. Just as quickly as your anger had ignited, it was gone, and you were standing awkwardly on the safe side of the threshold feeling your heartbeat hammering away at your rib cage. Blood rushed to your face, embarrassment and shame prickling against your skin as you attempted to come up with something threatening to say.

“Leave.” You hated that it came out a somewhat choked warble, even as you moved to slam the door in their smug faces.

Ever the smart one, Shinsou blocked it from closing with his coat; Kaminari caught on quickly enough to go fetch a stick from nearby and replace the offending garment with it. Even though they couldn’t cross the threshold, apparently they were smart enough to keep the door open. You attempted several more times — only to be stopped by a fucking stick — to slam it before surrendering and stumbling back. The door creaked open slowly and you made sure to glare at the men on the other side.

“Are you kidding me?” A ringing in your ears suddenly chilled you to your core, and your previous irritation gave way to legitimate fear as Shinsou leaned forward, leveling his face with yours.

“Aren’t you going to invite us in?” Panic settled over you. Panic. Scream. Run. Your body didn’t move. Compulsion was a tricky thing, though; Shinsou didn’t really even need to use it, considering his own special ability. You stayed silent, staring at him with a scowl despite the low thrum in your mind. They couldn’t make you invite them in. You didn’t have even the slightest inclination to let them into your safe space. Nobody even had a key to your little house, thanks to your paranoia.

“C’mon, Y/N, don’t be like that!” Kaminari whined, still grinning over Shinsous shoulder and you grit your teeth. Shinsou stared into your eyes thoughtfully, obviously weighing his options.

“Haven’t you missed us?” A pang in your chest. You had missed Kaminari. Even Shinsou, in a weird sort of way. You’d come into the fold after Shinsou had been turned — essentially his replacement — but you and Kaminari had hit it off and despite everything, their lingering friendship had remained and ruined everything for you. Jirou had told you, offhandedly, about how close they were; you could see now it had been a warning.

“Then come here.” Their grins grew when you inched over the threshold at the soft command, only amplified by the teasing beckoning motion Kaminari used. Before your sudden change in situation even full processed, you were sandwiched between the vampires; caged between them by two sets of arms coiled around you. You could feel your heart in your throat, beating wildly as you trashed and squirmed about, letting out a soft curse for having been so stupid.

And then Kaminari was kissing you.

It was hard and fast and needy, and you could taste the want on his tongue. You hadn’t even noticed you’d went limp in Shinsous grip until he chuckled and nuzzled at your neck. Your fingers dug into the front of Kaminari’s shirt, torn between pulling him closer and pushing him away. Luckily, the blond made the decision for you and pulled back, licking his lips and pressing his forehead to yours. He didn’t even spare a glance at Shinsou, who’d taken to peppering feather light kisses at your pulse; you were admittedly dazed but thoroughly enjoying the sensation.

“See? Not that bad, is it?” Kaminari purred. Shinsou scoffed out a laugh against your skin and you flinched when something sharp — presumably his fangs — dragged along your neck.

“Y/N?!” Jirous voice garnered your attention, and everybody seemed to freeze at the interruption. How the pair of vampires had missed the arrival of your hunter friends was beyond you, but after Shinsou released you with a sigh and stepped off the porch, Kaminari pressed another kiss to your cheek before following. You were a flustered, blushing mess on your front porch as they shouldered by the hunters and headed on their merry way.

“Uh—” You couldn’t look at any of your friends as they hurried to fuss over you, looking for any signs of being bitten.

It took several seconds of their pestering before you worked up the nerve to tell them that they hadn’t bitten you, much less tried anything else even remotely sinister. They’d just been toying with you, like you and Kaminari had toyed with Shinsou. Jirou had looked at you with something akin to understanding; you realized that the two of you had a very heavy cross to bare. You knew your affection for your vampiric lovers would bring nothing but trouble, and wondered what exactly it would mean for you in the future.
trail.content:
Kaminari x Reader x Shinsou

Summary: You just couldn’t help yourself.

title: Breeze
body:
Inasa x Reader

Summary: Maybe being someones omega wouldn’t be all that bad after all.

Commissioned By Tatianna | Subscribe to me on AO3! | Tip Me? | Patreon

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

The first thing you thought when you saw him was that you hated his cape. Being an omega, you had grown accustomed to the overwhelming, mingling scent of alphas, and so you didn’t notice his initially. You were too fixated on being tossed through the air not unlike a ragdoll when he unleashed his whirlwind attack. When you managed to escape — bouncing ungracefully for a bit before turning a sharp corner and bolting — you’d thought he hadn’t noticed.

Boy, were you wrong.

His weight hit your back hard, and you went skidding across unforgiving concrete with him releasing very loud apologies — apparently he hadn’t meant to surf on your back like some kind of inconsiderate monster — and all you could think was that you were about to be apprehended by the dumbest hero alive.

“Could you get off of me?” You heaved, and he instantly leapt off of you, still rambling out his too-loud apologies. Not even bothering to assess the damage, you forced yourself up to a standing position with a wince, turning to glare at him with what you were sure was a mangled face.

“You didn’t have to be so rou—” His scent washed over you like a calming wave and your knees wobbled; the whiny reprimand you were about to release forgotten instantaneously. His nostrils flared, obviously having caught your scent too, and you could honestly say you’d never wanted to flee a situation more. He was your alpha? A goody-goody hero? Life sure was funny sometimes.

“Oh Hell no.” You sputtered; watching the heros gaze sharpen as you hurriedly backed away ignited something in you. A deep, primal sensation that you hated and loved all at once. He reached you in a few large steps, grasping your chin with his ungloved hand and you wanted to melt. Your body was practically vibrating with excitement that you had finally found your partner — your other half; your perfect match. It all seemed so cliche and your rational mind hated it.

“You would deny me?” The question was said gruffly, the underlying scent of alpha hitting you full force. His distress at the idea hurt you; the omega in you wanted to soothe him and assure him that you would never but it was a lie. That’s exactly what you were doing. Denying your alpha. Denying your bond. Running from your mate.

Rather than respond to his loaded question, you teleported to the rooftop and took off in a sprint, flashing between buildings with unnatural precision; silently cursing that you had such awful luck.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

“You never answered me, omega!” The next time you’re unfortunate to have a run in with the windy hero, the two of you recognize each other immediately. His voice was too loud, booming down on you and everyone else not unlike a loud speaker. You glared up at him before turning and taking off in a run, admittedly feeling humiliated that all eyes in the area had zeroed in on you. Omega. It was a curse. Being seen as a dainty little creature in need of saving, or worse, a toy for alpha gratification. The twisted system is what had set you on the path to villainy in the first place.

“You can’t outrun me!” He called down, keeping pace with you with little effort, thanks to the fact he could practically fly. You rolled your eyes, teleporting between buildings in the hopes of losing him, and being unfortunate enough not to.

“Buzz off, hero!” You shouted back, finally, as you began to tire of trying to escape him. It was exhausting sprinting through town like some kind of mad woman.

Inasa dropped down in front of you suddenly and you let out a curse as you toppled into his arms, moving too fast to stop yourself. You hated that when his arms wrapped around you it felt so safe, but more than that you hated the fact that you instinctively nuzzled your face into his chest, breathing him in. There was a rumble that sounded almost like a purr; when it evolved into laughter is when you angrily untangled yourself from his hold, glaring.

“You’re fiery,” His smile when he spoke was disarming. “I like that!” If he hadn’t said it quite so loud, it might have been endearing. But the fact he was practically shouting it out for the world to hear was mortifying; you could feel your face warming in embarrassment.

“You’re too loud.” You grumbled back, and his boisterous laughter actually made you smile a bit before you teleported away this time. You outright laughed at his surprised shout.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

When you see him in civilian wear for the first time, you actually laugh so hard you cry. Typically you would have shied away from the attention, snarling at anyone who so much as glanced at you, but the sheer shock of how ridiculous the powerful Gale Force looked had you howling. It was clear he had no sense of style; every glance back to make sure you were, in fact, seeing him and not some unfortunate look-alike just made you laugh harder. It only got worse when he spotted you and joyously joined your laughter, completely unaware that you were laughing at him.

“Omega! It’s so good to see you again!” You didn’t know how because technically he should have already arrested you several times over, but you couldn’t help but share the sentiment, grinning at him as you finally contained yourself.

“My name is Y/N.” Inasa repeated your name loudly, and you sighed, cracking a small smile.

“I am Inasa Yoarashi!” He grabbed your hands in his, looking overjoyed that the two of you were holding a civil conversation.

“Nice to meet you, alpha.” You were startled when his arms curled around you, lifting you easily and spinning you around in his excitement. The acknowledgment probably meant a lot to him, considering how deliberately distant you had chosen to be. When he nuzzled against your neck, you let out a huff of amusement. Scenting your partner was typically reserved for later in the relationship, but you figured you could let him get away with it, considering how many times he’d let you off the hook when you most definitely should have been in handcuffs.

You didn’t even argue when he literally carried you out of the of the store, rambling in his booming voice about how the two of you would definitely need to discuss your line of work.

Inasa x Reader

Rather than respond to his loaded question, you teleported to the rooftop and took off in a sprint, flashing between buildings with unnatural precision; silently cursing that you had such awful luck.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

“You never answered me, omega!” The next time you’re unfortunate to have a run in with the windy hero, the two of you recognize each other immediately. His voice was too loud, booming down on you and everyone else not unlike a loud speaker. You glared up at him before turning and taking off in a run, admittedly feeling humiliated that all eyes in the area had zeroed in on you. Omega. It was a curse. Being seen as a dainty little creature in need of saving, or worse, a toy for alpha gratification. The twisted system is what had set you on the path to villainy in the first place.

“You can’t outrun me!” He called down, keeping pace with you with little effort, thanks to the fact he could practically fly. You rolled your eyes, teleporting between buildings in the hopes of losing him, and being unfortunate enough not to.

“Buzz off, hero!” You shouted back, finally, as you began to tire of trying to escape him. It was exhausting sprinting through town like some kind of mad woman.

Inasa dropped down in front of you suddenly and you let out a curse as you toppled into his arms, moving too fast to stop yourself. You hated that when his arms wrapped around you it felt so safe, but more than that you hated the fact that you instinctively nuzzled your face into his chest, breathing him in. There was a rumble that sounded almost like a purr; when it evolved into laughter is when you angrily untangled yourself from his hold, glaring.

“You’re fiery,” His smile when he spoke was disarming. “I like that!” If he hadn’t said it quite so loud, it might have been endearing. But the fact he was practically shouting it out for the world to hear was mortifying; you could feel your face warming in embarrassment.

“You’re too loud.” You grumbled back, and his boisterous laughter actually made you smile a bit before you teleported away this time. You outright laughed at his surprised shout.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *

When you see him in civilian wear for the first time, you actually laugh so hard you cry. Typically you would have shied away from the attention, snarling at anyone who so much as glanced at you, but the sheer shock of how ridiculous the powerful Gale Force looked had you howling. It was clear he had no sense of style; every glance back to make sure you were, in fact, seeing him and not some unfortunate look-alike just made you laugh harder. It only got worse when he spotted you and joyously joined your laughter, completely unaware that you were laughing at him.

“Omega! It’s so good to see you again!” You didn’t know how because technically he should have already arrested you several times over, but you couldn’t help but share the sentiment, grinning at him as you finally contained yourself.

“My name is Y/N.” Inasa repeated your name loudly, and you sighed, cracking a small smile.

“I am Inasa Yoarashi!” He grabbed your hands in his, looking overjoyed that the two of you were holding a civil conversation.

“Nice to meet you, alpha.” You were startled when his arms curled around you, lifting you easily and spinning you around in his excitement. The acknowledgment probably meant a lot to him, considering how deliberately distant you had chosen to be. When he nuzzled against your neck, you let out a huff of amusement. Scenting your partner was typically reserved for later in the relationship, but you figured you could let him get away with it, considering how many times he’d let you off the hook when you most definitely should have been in handcuffs.

You didn’t even argue when he literally carried you out of the of the store, rambling in his booming voice about how the two of you would definitely need to discuss your line of work.
